opt2: Either p is permitted or ~p is permitted
question: Which of the following is not a principle of deontic logic?
opt3: If an act is obligatory, it is permitted
opt4: A tautological act is obligatory, and a contradictory act is forbidden
opt1: The disjunction of (p V q) is permitted, if and only if at least one of the 2 acts described in p or q is permitted
